Conversion between PoR to geographical coordinate system

Source: R/coordinates.R
por_transformation.Rd

Transform spherical objects from PoR to geographical coordinate system and vice versa.

Usage

PoR_to_geographical(x, ep)

geographical_to_PoR(x, ep)

Arguments

x

sf, SpatRast, or Raster* object of the data points in geographical or PoR coordinate system

ep

data.frame of the geographical coordinates of the Euler pole (lat, lon)

Value

sf or SpatRast object of the data points in the transformed geographical or PoR coordinate system

Details

The PoR coordinate reference system is oblique transformation of the geographical coordinate system with the Euler pole coordinates being the translation factors.

Examples

data("nuvel1")
euler <- subset(nuvel1, nuvel1$plate.rot == "na") # North America relative to Pacific plate
data("san_andreas")
san_andreas.por <- geographical_to_PoR(san_andreas, euler)
PoR_to_geographical(san_andreas.por, euler)
